communication

Class Synchronizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • toolbox.observers.ExceptionEmitter
      • communication.Synchronizer

  • public class Synchronizer
extends ExceptionEmitter
    The class managing the communication between the devices. The application and the emulator have each a synchronizer, which is responsible of the coordination of their respective clients and servers.
    Author:
    Charles MECHERIKI

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Synchronizer(TCPConnectionObserver _serverConnectionObserver, TCPParameters _serverTCPParameters, TCPConnectionObserver _clientConnectionObserver, TCPParameters _clientTCPParameters)
      Constructs and initialize the synchronizer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean clientIsClosed()
      Returns whether the client's connection is closed.
      void connectClient()
      Tries to connect the client to the other device's server.
      void disconnectClient()
      Disconnects the client from the other device's server.
      void launchServer()
      Launches the server.
      void newProtocolInterpreter(Protocol.Tag _tag, Interpreter<?> _interpreter)
      Adds a new interpreter to the synchronizer's protocol with the given tag key.
      void rebootClientWithNewParameters(TCPParameters _TCPParameters)
      Reboots the client with new TCP parameters.
      void rebootServerWithNewParameters(TCPParameters _TCPParameters)
      Reboots the server with new TCP parameters.
      void send(Protocol.Flag _flag, Protocol.Tag _tag, java.lang.Object _object)
      Sends a packet (created on the fly) from the device's client to the other device's server.
      void sendBye()
      Sends a 'bye' packet to the other device.
      void sendException(java.lang.Exception _exception)
      Sends an exception packet to the other device.
      void sendHey()
      Sends a 'hey' packet to the other device.
      void sendObject(Protocol.Tag _tag, java.lang.Object _object)
      Sends to send an object packet, with a particular tag, interpreted accordingly by the other device (cf. the server's routine method).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Synchronizer

        public Synchronizer(TCPConnectionObserver _serverConnectionObserver,
                    TCPParameters _serverTCPParameters,
                    TCPConnectionObserver _clientConnectionObserver,
                    TCPParameters _clientTCPParameters)
        Constructs and initialize the synchronizer.
        Parameters:
        _serverConnectionObserver - the server connection observer from the device
        _serverTCPParameters - the TCP parameters for the server
        _clientConnectionObserver - the client connection observer from the device
        _clientTCPParameters - the TCP parameters for the client

    • Method Detail

      • newProtocolInterpreter

        public void newProtocolInterpreter(Protocol.Tag _tag,
                                   Interpreter<?> _interpreter)
        Adds a new interpreter to the synchronizer's protocol with the given tag key.
        Parameters:
        _tag - the tag key for the interpreter
        _interpreter - the interpreter to add

      • sendHey

        public void sendHey()
        Sends a 'hey' packet to the other device. This packet is interpreted as a request to connect its client (cf. the server's routine method).

      • sendBye

        public void sendBye()
        Sends a 'bye' packet to the other device. This packet is interpreted as a request to disconnect its client (cf. the server's routine method).

      • sendException

        public void sendException(java.lang.Exception _exception)
        Sends an exception packet to the other device. This packet is interpreted as an internal exception (cf. the server's routine method).
        Parameters:
        _exception - the exception to send

      • sendObject

        public void sendObject(Protocol.Tag _tag,
                       java.lang.Object _object)
        Sends to send an object packet, with a particular tag, interpreted accordingly by the other device (cf. the server's routine method).
        Parameters:
        _tag - the tag for the packet to send
        _object - the object for the packet

      • send

        public void send(Protocol.Flag _flag,
                 Protocol.Tag _tag,
                 java.lang.Object _object)
        Sends a packet (created on the fly) from the device's client to the other device's server.
        Parameters:
        _flag - the flag for the packet
        _tag - the tag for the packet
        _object - the object for the packet

        Launches the server.
